title.narrative: UNODC Institutional Transparency and Citizen Participation at municipal levels
UNODC Institutionell transparens och medborgarinflytande på kommunal nivå

description.narrative: Objective 1: Number of Autonomous Municipal Governments have reduced their levels of corruption risks in at least 12 identified areas. Objective 2: Organized civil society, with emphasis on women's organizations, is empowered to exercise its right to social control in the beneficiary municipalities. Objective 3: Culture of transparency and integrity has been promoted in the targeted municipalities. new Objective 4: An official Bolivian data base on species of plants and animals living in Bolivian forests has been produced.

Insatsen syftar till att stärka en kultur av transparens och minska korruptionen i 60 utvalda kommuner genom att stärka den tekniska kompetensen för de kvinnor och män som arbetar i kommunerna vad avser effektiv kommunal förvaltning.

UNODC has applied to Sida for funding of 18 million SEK to carry out the "Institutional Transparency and Citizen Participation at municipal levels" in 60 selected Bolivian municipalities, during the period June 2017 – March 2020.
The idea behind the present proposal is that selected municipalities will start promoting a culture of transparency, while receiving technical assistance to improve the municipal officials' skills in order to deliver more efficient services to their communities. Also, civil society organisations, especially led by women, will also receive technical assistance to enhance their social control capabilities.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During 2020, despite the adverse coronavirus effects, the advances in the intervention were as follows: Objective 1: 59 municipalities have concluded their diagnoses to determine their most vulnerable areas of corruption, which are: i) budget planning and execution, ii) tax management, iii) accounting and internal control, iv) municipal procedures and services, v) human resources, vi) procurement, vii) access to municipal information, viii) legislation and follow-up, and ix) promotion of transparency and fight against corruption. In addition 54 municipalities have issued municipal laws or decrees aproving their own municipal policies on transparency and fight against corruption. Objective 2: 1453 representatives from civil society (65% of which were female), were trained on accountability, rights to information, social control, transparent transition and procurement. Objective 3: 319 teachers (of which 208 were women) from almost 100 municipalities in the country have been trained in the use of the tool box on transparency (updated by UNODC under the present contribution). While initially the training was directed only to teachers working in the targeted municipalities, positive externalities determined that such training could benefit also to neighboring municipalities. It should be stressed that 252 teachers had the opportunity to apply/teach the learned tools thus reaching to 2.931 students (of which, 54,4% were female). Further, 48 national youth networks on transparency, created in the targeted municipalities, started to develop different activities promoting transparency values. Objective 4: A Case Study on species of plants and animals living in Bolivian forests has been produced. Three municipalities in the Bolivian amazonia were chosen to participate in such case studies. The final results on this case study will be ready in the begining of the second half of 2021.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
